channel.title: CVE Feed for Lenovo -- XClarity Administrator
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Lenovo -- XClarity Administrator

item.title: CVE-2020-8355|2024-09-17T01:56:10.746Z -- lenovo -- xclarity%20administrator
item.description: An internal product security audit of Lenovo XClarity Administrator (LXCA) prior to version 3.1.0 discovered the Windows OS credentials provided by the LXCA user to perform driver updates of managed systems may be captured in the First Failure Data Capture (FFDC) service log if the service log is generated while managed endpoints are updating. The service log is only generated when requested by a privileged LXCA user and it is only accessible to the privileged LXCA user that requested the file and is then deleted.

item.title: CVE-2024-45104|2024-09-13T17:48:48.901Z -- lenovo -- xclarity%20administrator
item.description: A valid, authenticated LXCA user without sufficient privileges may be able to use the device identifier to modify an LXCA managed device through a specially crafted web API call.

item.title: CVE-2024-45103|2024-09-13T17:49:12.258Z -- lenovo -- xclarity%20administrator
item.description: A valid, authenticated LXCA user may be able to unmanage an LXCA managed device in through the LXCA web interface without sufficient privileges.

item.title: CVE-2024-45101|2024-09-13T17:50:38.901Z -- lenovo -- xclarity%20administrator
item.description: A privilege escalation vulnerability was discovered when Single Sign On (SSO) is enabled that could allow an attacker to intercept a valid, authenticated LXCA userâ€™s XCC session if they can convince the user to click on a specially crafted URL.

item.title: CVE-2023-4605|2024-08-02T07:31:06.648Z -- lenovo -- xclarity%20administrator
item.description: A valid authenticated Lenovo XClarity Administrator (LXCA) user can potentially leverage an unauthenticated API endpoint to retrieve system event information.

item.title: CVE-2023-4605|2024-04-05T20:44:43.105Z -- lenovo -- xclarity%20administrator
item.description: A valid authenticated Lenovo XClarity Administrator (LXCA) user can potentially leverage an unauthenticated API endpoint to retrieve system event information.

item.description: A valid authenticated Lenovo XClarity Administrator (LXCA) user can potentially leverage an unauthenticated API endpoint to retrieve system event information.
